item.title: Elon Musk might have just accidentally revealed that a lot of MAGA influencers are based in South Asia, Africa and Eastern Europe
item.description: Elon Musk’s X unveiled a feature Saturday that lets users see where an account is based. Oops.

item.title: ‘Dr. Doom’ Nouriel Roubini breaks with the crowd on the AI bubble, saying the U.S. is headed for a ‘growth recession’ and not a market crash
item.description: “The now common view,” according to the NYU Stern School of Business professor emeritus, “is incorrect over the medium term.”

item.title: Meet Ralph Lee Abraham, the CDC’s new second-in-command who believes the Affordable Care Act should be repealed and called vaccines ‘dangerous’
item.description: Abraham, 70, started his career in veterinary medicine.

item.title: Outside the U.S. and Europe, the momentum of China’s open source AI models is plain to see
item.description: Control over costs and data trump pure performance for businesses in many parts of the world.

item.title: ‘Just enough to spend, not enough to splurge’: The low-hire labor market bites for Gen Z and lower-income Americans, JPMorgan finds
item.description: Workers ages 50–54 are experiencing negative real income growth, year over year, so reality bites for Gen Xers in the 2025 economy, too.
